intro: Canscorinella deccanensis, commonly known as the Deccan scurvy grass, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops. The plant is characterized by its small, green, succulent leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in dry and semi-arid regions, often found in rocky soils. This species is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
